title: Punjab Protesters At His Doors, Kejriwal Makes New Poll Promise & Big Claim On Congress, BJP 'Tie-Up' - News18
summary:
Kejriwal Promises to Waive Water Bills Amid Punjab Protests

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: News18

During a recent protest by Punjab women outside Arvind Kejriwal's home, he promised that inflated water bills would be waived off if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) returns to power in Delhi.

  • Kejriwal claims that Congress and BJP should formally announce their collaboration in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.
  • He suggests that the recent inflated water bills are a result of interference by the BJP while he was in jail.
  • The AAP leader assures the public that those unfairly charged on water bills should refrain from paying until elections.
  • Punjab women protest against AAP's unfulfilled promises, demanding clarity on their financial assistance scheme.
  • Criticism arises from Congress and BJP regarding AAP's promises and governance track record.
“We have come from Amritsar to put forward our matters. Do not cheat the women of Delhi as you did with the women of Punjab,” said a protesting woman.

Kejriwal's statements come as the assembly elections approach, with polling expected in February 2025.
newTitle: Kejriwal Promises to Waive Water Bills Amid Punjab Protests

title: 'Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy': PM Modi - News18
summary:
Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy

Date: January 04, 2025   Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that the Indian government's initiatives are energizing rural India, aiming to empower communities and transform villages into hubs of growth.

  • PM Modi spoke at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025, celebrating rural India's resilience.
  • He highlighted increasing accessibility to healthcare services in rural areas.
  • An approximate Rs. 3 lakh crore in financial assistance has been provided to farmers under the PM-KISAN scheme.
“During the COVID pandemic, the world doubted how Indian villages would tackle the crisis, but we ensured vaccines reached the last person in every village.” – PM Modi

The Prime Minister's remarks reflect ongoing government efforts to enhance rural infrastructure and economic stability, aiming for a 'Viksit Bharat' (Developed India) by 2047.
newTitle: PM Modi Highlights Government Initiatives Transforming Rural India

title: 2 Ex-Armymen Killed Woman, 17-Day-Old Twins And Hid For 19 Years; Arrested - NDTV
summary:
Army Deserters Arrested After 19 Years for Killing Woman and 17-Day-Old Twins

Date & Source: Published on 2022-01-14, News18

Introduction: Two former Indian Army men were arrested in Kochi on Saturday, 15 years after they allegedly murdered a 24-year-old woman and her 17-day-old twin daughters in Kerala's Kollam district. The duo, who were serving in the Army at the time, went into hiding and managed to evade the law for nearly two decades.

  1. Dibil Kumar B and Rajesh P, both from the Indian Army's 45 AD Regiment in Pathankot, were accused of murdering Ranjini and her twin daughters in February 2006.
  2. The woman's mother discovered the bodies upon returning from the panchayat office, where she had gone to get the twins' birth certificates.
  3. Kumar was in a relationship with Ranjini but began distancing himself after the twins were born, leading to a paternity test order by the Kerala State Women's Commission.
  4. CBI arrested Kumar and Rajesh on Friday after they had been living under fake names in Puducherry with new families.
"After years of pursuit, the CBI received a tip-off that Kumar and Rajesh were living in Puducherry under fake names and had managed to get new documents made, including Aadhaar cards. They had reportedly married two teachers in the city and had also fathered children." - CBI officials

Conclusion: The accused have been remanded in police custody until January 18, and the CBI will seek their custody for further investigation.
newTitle: Army Deserters Arrested After 19 Years for Killing Woman and 17-Day-Old Twins

title: 'Went here and there…': On Lalu Yadav's offer, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar says won't repeat ‘mistake’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nitish Kumar Rejects Lalu Yadav's Alliance Offer, Reflects on Bihar's Progress

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar criticizes the previous government led by Lalu Prasad Yadav while rejecting an alliance offer, emphasizing Bihar's development since 2005.

  • Nitish Kumar attacks Lalu Prasad's government pre-2005, citing poor conditions in Bihar.
  • He highlights significant improvements in education, health, and infrastructure under his leadership.
  • Kumar's review meeting underscores commitment to continuing development without alliances.
  • Lalu Yadav extended an invitation for partnership in the 'Mahagathbandan', but Kumar declined.
  • Tejashwi Yadav, Lalu's son, downplays Lalu's invitation, suggesting it was merely a response to media inquiries.
“Before the year 2005, Bihar ki halat kaafi kharab thi (the condition of Bihar was really bad).” - Nitish Kumar

Kumar's remarks underline a significant political divide in Bihar as he positions himself as a leader focused on development without reliance on past alliances.
newTitle: Nitish Kumar Rejects Lalu Yadav's Alliance Offer, Reflects on Bihar's Progress

title: MP: Fun gone wrong? 4 found dead in septic tank of house they visited for party - Hindustan Times
Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
summary:
Dense Fog Engulfs Delhi; Flight Operations Hit at IGI Airport

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Unknown

Nearly 500 flights faced disruptions at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to severe fog impacting northern India.

The dense fog has resulted in significant travel delays and cancellations, severely impacting air traffic across multiple states.

  • 412 flights delayed by over 45 minutes.
  • 45 flights cancelled due to poor weather conditions.
  • 19 flights diverted to alternate airports.
  • Zero visibility reported in New Delhi, especially between 11:30 p.m. and 8:30 a.m.
  • Intense fog conditions affected flights in multiple northern cities, including Chandigarh and Srinagar.
“Dense fog causing low visibility in northern belt continues to impact flight operations even during daytime hours,” - IndiGo.

This weather phenomenon underscores the ongoing challenges posed by extreme fog in the winter months, emphasizing the need for improved infrastructural responses to such disruptions.
newTitle: Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi's IGI Airport

title: BJP's First List For Delhi Polls Out, Ex-MP Parvesh Verma To Take On Arvind Kejriwal - News18
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
summary:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has indicated a distant approach from the ongoing farmers' protests led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, unlike the proactive measures taken during Modi's previous term.

  • Farmers have been protesting since February 2024 at the Punjab-Haryana borders, demanding legal status for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and a farm debt waiver.
  • Chouhan has extended an open invitation for talks, yet has not engaged directly with the protesting farmers.
  • The government's previous attempts to resolve farmer grievances, particularly in 2020-21, led to escalated tensions and prolonged protests.
  • Current protests are more localized and lack the broad unity seen in earlier movements.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, president of BKU Sidhupur, is on a hunger strike demanding response to farmers' issues from the government.
“Currently, the Supreme Court is looking into this issue. Whatever directives the Supreme Court gives, will be followed.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

This current strategy marks a significant shift in the government's handling of farmer-related issues, emphasizing a more detached stance in contrast to previous direct engagements.
newTitle: Modi Government's Distance from Farmers' Protests Explained

title: Metro section, first Namo Bharat connectivity: PM Modi to flag off big projects in Delhi on Jan 5 | Details - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi to Launch Over ₹12,200 Crore in Development Projects in Delhi

Date: January 4, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 5, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate various development projects worth over ₹12,200 crore in Delhi, ahead of the assembly elections.

  • The inaugural 13-kilometer Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut Namo Bharat Rapid Rail corridor is valued at ₹4,600 crore and will enhance connectivity between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar.
  • The Prime Minister will also open a 2.8 km stretch of Delhi Metro Phase-IV between Janakpuri and Krishna Park, costing about ₹1,200 crore.
  • Additional projects include the foundation stone for the 26.5 km Rithala - Kundli section of Delhi Metro Phase-IV, worth ₹6,230 crore, and a new building for the Central Ayurveda Research Institute at a cost of ₹185 crore.
“This will significantly ease travel between Delhi and Meerut and will benefit millions of people through high-speed and comfortable travel along with unmatched safety and reliability.”

The commencement of these projects is expected to provide numerous benefits to residents and improve overall infrastructure in the region.
newTitle: PM Modi to Launch Over ₹12,200 Crore in Development Projects in Delhi

title: Need to establish 5-6 more cooperatives like Amul: PM Modi - Deccan Herald
summary:
Need to establish 5-6 more cooperatives like Amul: PM Modi

Published on: 04 January 2025, 16:10 IST

In a speech at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav, Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the creation of additional cooperatives similar to Amul, emphasizing the importance of milk production for farmers.

  • Modi highlighted the need for 5 to 6 more cooperatives like Amul, which operates nationally.
  • He noted a significant increase in farmers' incomes due to milk production.
  • Amul's turnover for the financial year 2023-24 reached Rs 80,000 crore.
  • He advocated for more Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) to improve farmers' crop prices.
  • Reports indicate that 25 crore people have been lifted out of poverty in the past decade.
  • Consumption patterns in rural India are shifting, with food expenditure dropping below 50% of income.
“For the first time since independence, the expenditure on food in rural areas has fallen below 50 per cent,” Modi stated.

The Grameen Bharat Mahotsav, themed 'Building a Resilient Rural India for a Viksit Bharat 2047’, showcases rural aspirations and promotes various developmental schemes.
newTitle: PM Modi Advocates for More Cooperatives Like Amul

summary:

The national capital experienced unprecedented dense fog that resulted in zero visibility for nine hours, leading to significant disruptions in air traffic.

title: Delhi fog: City sees season's longest zero visibility spell; 400 flights delayed - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Fog: City Sees Season's Longest Zero Visibility Spell; 400 Flights Delayed

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025 11:50 PM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog enveloped Delhi on Saturday, leading to zero visibility for nine hours—the longest spell this season. The weather caused significant disruptions at the airport, including numerous flight delays and cancellations.

  • Visibility dropped to zero for nine hours affecting all flight operations.
  • Over 400 flights were delayed, with 19 flights diverted and 45 cancellations.
  • The city's primary weather station recorded eight hours of zero visibility.
  • Temperatures recorded were a maximum of 20 degrees Celsius and a minimum of 7.8 degrees Celsius.
  • The air quality index (AQI) stood at 378, indicating very poor air quality.
"Zero visibility prevailed for nine hours at Palam between 6 pm and 3 am (UTC), marking the longest spell of the season."

In conclusion, the persistent fog in Delhi severely impacted air travel, highlighting the need for enhanced weather preparedness.
newTitle: Delhi Fog Causes Major Flight Disruptions with Zero Visibility

Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla reviewed the State’s security situation just after taking office, amid rising tensions following mob violence in Kangpokpi district.

  • The Governor assessed security arrangements with senior officials, directing prioritization of public safety.

title: BPSC exam row: ‘Vanity van’ near Prashant Kishor’s protest site in Patna sparks controversy - The Hindu
summary:
Controversy Over 'Vanity Van' at Prashant Kishor’s Protest in Patna

Published Date: January 04, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Controversy erupted on January 4, 2025, over a 'vanity van' parked near the protest site of Prashant Kishor in Patna, where he is conducting a hunger strike over allegations of a questioned paper leak in the BPSC exam.

  • The vanity van, equipped with luxury facilities, raised eyebrows as it was located close to Gandhi Maidan, where Kishor's protest commenced on January 2, 2025.
  • Kishor highlighted the discrepancy between his protest and the lavish amenities, questioning the significance of restroom facilities compared to the future of BPSC aspirants.
  • A legal protest notice was issued by the district administration claiming the gathering was illegal as per a High Court order.
  • Over the last three weeks, several demonstrators have been actively advocating for a cancellation of the examination.
“I want to convey this through mediapersons... let this van be taken away and in return, give me ₹25 lakh per day and provide an alternate space that can be used as a washroom.” - Prashant Kishor

The situation surrounding Mr. Kishor's protest continues to be contentious, with authorities warning of actions against him and his supporters.
newTitle: Controversy Over 'Vanity Van' at Prashant Kishor’s Protest in Patna

title: India's security is our security: Maldives Foreign Minister Abdulla Khaleel - WION
summary:
India's security is our security: Maldives Foreign Minister Abdulla Khaleel

Source: WION

The visiting Maldives Foreign Minister Abdulla Khaleel emphasized the strengthening ties with India, stating that the security of India is directly linked to the Maldives. His remarks come during his inaugural visit to India in 2025, highlighting key discussions around bilateral cooperation and various developmental projects.

Key Points:

  • Khaleel affirmed that India's security is integral to the security of the Maldives.
  • Highlighting the positive trajectory in India-Maldives relations with high-level visits, including President Muizzu's trips to India.
  • India's significant financial assistance and developmental projects in the Maldives, including the Greater Male Connectivity Project.
  • An emphasis on mutual respect and historical ties underpinning the current relationship between the nations.
  • A strong commitment to enhancing defense collaboration and maritime security initiatives.
“We consider the security of India as our security as well.” - Abdulla Khaleel

The future of India-Maldives relations appears promising, as both nations aim for deeper economic integration and partnership in development projects, particularly in sectors like housing and maritime security.

Tamil Nadu govt. declares holiday on January 17 - The Hindu
summary:
Tamil Nadu Government Declares Holiday on January 17 for Pongal Celebrations

Publication Date: January 4, 2025 Source: The Hindu

On January 4, 2025, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced a holiday on January 17, 2025, for government offices, public sector undertakings, schools, and colleges across the state in light of the Pongal festival.

  • The Pongal festival is celebrated on January 15, with holidays on the 16th, 18th, and 19th.
  • The decision to declare January 17 as a holiday was made following requests from government employees and students who will be traveling to their native places to celebrate the festival.
"As a lot of government employees and students will go to their native places to celebrate Pongal, there was a request to declare a holiday on January 17 as well. The government has considered their request and declared a holiday on January 17," said Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

This decision reflects the government's responsiveness to the cultural significance of Pongal and the needs of its citizens.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu Government Declares Holiday on January 17 for Pongal Celebrations

title: Congress launches ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan’ campaign targeting Shah for ‘insulting’ Ambedkar - The Hindu
summary:
Congress launches ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan’ campaign targeting Shah for ‘insulting’ Ambedkar

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Congress has initiated a campaign demanding the resignation of Home Minister Amit Shah over his comments deemed insulting to B.R. Ambedkar. The campaign, titled ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan,’ spans from January 3 to January 26, culminating in a rally in Mhow, Ambedkar's birthplace.

  • The campaign encourages village-level meetings to educate the public about alleged insults toward Ambedkar and the Constitution.
  • The initial rally was postponed due to national mourning for former PM Manmohan Singh.
  • Demands include Shah's resignation for derogatory remarks made about Ambedkar.
  • Accusations include the BJP’s attempts to demonize national leaders and undermine democracy.
“We reiterate our demand to sack Home Minister Amit Shah for his derogatory remarks against Dr. Ambedkar.” - Pawan Khera

This campaign underscores growing tensions between the Congress and BJP regarding the legacy of Dr. Ambedkar and other national leaders.
newTitle: Congress launches campaign against Amit Shah for remarks on Ambedkar

Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's wife Nikita, mother-in-law Nishan and brother-in-law Anurag granted bail in suicide case | Today News - Mint
summary:
Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

Publication Date: Saturday
Source: ANI

Bengaluru's City Civil Court has granted bail to Nikita Singhania, the wife of deceased techie Atul Subhash, along with her mother Nisha and brother Anurag, who were accused in his suicide case.

  • Nikita was arrested in Gurugram, while her family members were apprehended in Prayagraj.
  • They were held in custody following the discovery of a suicide note and video of Atul.
  • The lawyer mentioned that the suicide note and video have been sent for forensic analysis.
  • The bail was granted amid claims of harassment and emotional distress from Atul's side.
  • There are plans to challenge the bail order in the High Court of Karnataka.
“We will challenge it (bail order)... After seeing the order sheet, and analysing it, we can approach the High Court of Karnataka.” - Vinay Singh, Advocate

Atul Subhash, who worked for a private company, had left behind a detailed suicide note citing marital issues. His case highlights ongoing concerns around emotional distress and legal disputes in relationships.
newTitle: Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

title: Rajagopala Chidambaram: Physicist who played key role in India's bid to secure nuclear state tag - ThePrint
summary:
Rajagopala Chidambaram: Physicist who played key role in India's bid to secure nuclear state tag

Publication Date: January 4, 2022 | Source: The Print

Rajagopala Chidambaram, a prominent physicist and key figure in India's nuclear weapons program, passed away at the age of 88, leaving behind a significant legacy influencing India's strategic self-reliance.

  • Chidambaram was instrumental in India’s nuclear tests in 1974 and 1998.
  • His work led to India being declared a nuclear state by PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee.
  • Contributions included advancements in nuclear technology and other scientific fields.
  • Chidambaram was recognized with India's highest civilian honors, Padma Shri and Padma Vibhushan.
  • His passing marks the end of an era in Indian science and technology.
“His contributions furthered India’s nuclear prowess and strategic self-reliance. His loss is an irreparable one for the scientific community and the nation.” - Ajit Kumar Mohanty

The legacy of Rajagopala Chidambaram is celebrated for shaping India's scientific landscape and nuclear capabilities, marking him as a pivotal figure in the nation’s modern history.
newTitle: Remembering Rajagopala Chidambaram: Key Architect of India's Nuclear Program

title: Wife, her mother and brother get bail in case of abetting Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's suicide - NDTV
summary:
Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

Date: Today | Source: Bengaluru Court

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in the abetment of suicide case against them following Subhash's suicide on December 9.

  • Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania and her family were accused of harassment leading to his death.
  • They had previously appealed to the Karnataka High Court for expedited bail proceedings.
  • Subhash left a video and a detailed note accusing his wife and her relatives of torturing him.
  • Nikita was arrested in Gurugram; her family members were arrested in Prayagraj.
  • The parents of Subhash are seeking custody of their grandson.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” said Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father.

This case raises serious concerns about marital harassment and the mental health of individuals facing familial pressures.
newTitle: Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

title: BJP Candidates List for Delhi Elections 2025: Full list of Bharatiya Janata Party candidates for Delhi polls - The Indian Express
summary:
BJP Candidates List for Delhi Elections 2025

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Indian Express

More about the candidates:

The Bharatiya Janata Party has announced its candidate list for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections in 2025, showcasing a mix of experienced politicians and new faces across various constituencies.

  • Raj Kumar Bhatia will contest from Adarsh Nagar against AAP's Mukesh Goel.
  • Kulwant Rana, a former BJP vice president, will contest from Rithala.
  • Manoj Shokeen has been the president of Outer Delhi BJP since 2017 and is contesting from Nangloi Jat.
  • Rajkumar Chauhan, a former Congress MLA, will run from Mangolpuri.
  • Vijender Gupta, the current MLA from Rohini, is running again from that constituency.
  • Rekha Gupta, a member of BJP National Executive, is contesting from Shalimar Bagh.
  • Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma will contest against AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal from New Delhi.
  • Ramesh Bhiduri will challenge CM Atishi from Kalkaji.
The announcement indicates the BJP's strategy to consolidate its power in Delhi amidst strong competition from the AAP.

With a diverse candidate list, the BJP aims to secure key positions in the upcoming elections and strengthen its influence in Delhi's political landscape.
newTitle: BJP Announces Candidates for Delhi Elections 2025

title: Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Wife, In-Laws Get Bail In Abetment Of Suicide Case - NDTV
summary:
Bengaluru Court Grants Bail to Atul Subhash's Wife and In-Laws in Suicide Case

Publication Date: Today Source: Local News

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in an abetment of suicide case.

  • Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9, citing harassment from his wife and her family.
  • His wife Nikita, her mother Nisha, and brother Anurag were granted bail after an appeal to the session court.
  • On December 14, the wife and in-laws were arrested in connection with the case.
  • Subhash left behind a video and note detailing harassment, extortion, and allegations against his wife and her relatives.
  • His parents are seeking custody of their four-year-old grandson, expressing concerns for his welfare.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note also mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” - Pawan Kumar, father of Atul Subhash.
